content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun challenge, thanks!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very meta-exercise, and fun to do.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very nice idea ! I think it could be done in reverse mode

I do love the idea. 
It is however way too difficult for REVERSE.

I don't see the reason of simplification for SHORTEST. Adding a third sort by time isn't changing the puzzle. I think you should commit to the idea.  

Maybe it is because I'm not a native english speaker but I found the goal section a bit confusing. I think the following is correct and clearer:
- If type is FASTEST or REVERSE the player that needed less time for solution is on top
- If type is SHORTEST the player that has shorter solution  is on top

Goal section
* The first point should be "FASTEST or REVERSE" instead of "FASTER or SHORTER".

* The second point should be "SHORTEST" instead of "SHORTER". Please also change "smaller" to "shorter". Then please mention less time is better in the case of same code length.

* Please mention that all the given [[time]]s are measured in seconds.

Input section
* Please change "1. line" to "line 1".

* Please remove the quotation marks.

* Please change "2. line" to "line 2".

* Suggest not to mention "i-th", the various values should be formatted as [[variables]] instead of {{constants}}, variable types should be mentioned, and the variable names should be consistent throughout all the sections including the stub generator. So:

<<next [[n]] lines:>> Each line includes the data for one player: [[name]] [[score]] [[time]] [[size]] separated by spaces. [[score]], [[time]] and [[size]] are all non-negative integers.

Output section
* Please revise the format and wording, similar to my last comment. Please also mention "separated by spaces".

Constraints section
* I think n can never be 1 in real life? But it's up to you for the purpose of this clash.

* 2nd to 4th constraints: Please format the [[variables]], and also use the same names as in above sections.

Thanks.
My first contribution. Please leave some comments with your opinion and suggestions.
You might be able to shorten the constrains by stating: All names, times and length of codes are unique
Thank you. I hope I've fixed all problems you pointed out.
I removed reverse mode and changed goal text.

Thank you.
Some people think it's too hard to reverse, so I removed it.

Input section
* Please change [[size]] to [[length]] for consistency.

Stub generator
* Please change [[size]] to [[length]] for consistency.

Thanks.
Wow. I completely overlooked it. Thank you!
